trans-unit.source: Configure MPIO for your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure MPIO for your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to configure Multipath I/O (MPIO) for your StorSimple device connected to a host running Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to configure Multipath I/O (MPIO) for your StorSimple device connected to a host running Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Configure Multipath I/O for your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Configure Multipath I/O for your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Microsoft built support for the Multipath I/O (MPIO) feature in Windows Server to help build highly available, fault-tolerant SAN configurations.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft built support for the Multipath I/O (MPIO) feature in Windows Server to help build highly available, fault-tolerant SAN configurations.

trans-unit.source: MPIO uses redundant physical path components — adapters, cables, and switches — to create logical paths between the server and the storage device.
trans-unit.target: MPIO uses redundant physical path components — adapters, cables, and switches — to create logical paths between the server and the storage device.

trans-unit.source: If there is a component failure, causing a logical path to fail, multipathing logic uses an alternate path for I/O so that applications can still access their data.
trans-unit.target: If there is a component failure, causing a logical path to fail, multipathing logic uses an alternate path for I/O so that applications can still access their data.

trans-unit.source: Additionally depending on your configuration, MPIO can also improve performance by re-balancing the load across all these paths.
trans-unit.target: Additionally depending on your configuration, MPIO can also improve performance by re-balancing the load across all these paths.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [MPIO overview](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc725907.aspx "MPIO overview and features").
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [MPIO overview](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc725907.aspx "MPIO overview and features").

trans-unit.source: For the high-availability of your StorSimple solution, MPIO should be configured on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: For the high-availability of your StorSimple solution, MPIO should be configured on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: When MPIO is installed on your host servers running Windows Server 2012 R2, the servers can then tolerate a link, network, or interface failure.
trans-unit.target: When MPIO is installed on your host servers running Windows Server 2012 R2, the servers can then tolerate a link, network, or interface failure.

trans-unit.source: MPIO is an optional feature on Windows Server and is not installed by default.
trans-unit.target: MPIO is an optional feature on Windows Server and is not installed by default.

trans-unit.source: It should be installed as a feature through Server Manager.
trans-unit.target: It should be installed as a feature through Server Manager.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the steps you should follow to install and use the MPIO feature on a host running Windows Server 2012 R2 and connected to a StorSimple physical device.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the steps you should follow to install and use the MPIO feature on a host running Windows Server 2012 R2 and connected to a StorSimple physical device.

trans-unit.source: MPIO is not supported on a StorSimple virtual device.
trans-unit.target: MPIO is not supported on a StorSimple virtual device.

trans-unit.source: You will need to follow these steps to configure MPIO on your StorSimple device:
trans-unit.target: You will need to follow these steps to configure MPIO on your StorSimple device:

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Install MPIO on the Windows Server host
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Install MPIO on the Windows Server host

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Configure MPIO for StorSimple volumes
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Configure MPIO for StorSimple volumes

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Mount StorSimple volumes on the host
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Mount StorSimple volumes on the host

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Configure MPIO for high availability and load balancing
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Configure MPIO for high availability and load balancing

trans-unit.source: Each of the above steps is discussed in the following sections.
trans-unit.target: Each of the above steps is discussed in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Install MPIO on the Windows Server host
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Install MPIO on the Windows Server host

trans-unit.source: To install this feature on your Windows Server host, complete the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To install this feature on your Windows Server host, complete the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: To install MPIO on the host
trans-unit.target: To install MPIO on the host

trans-unit.source: Open Server Manager on your Windows Server host.
trans-unit.target: Open Server Manager on your Windows Server host.

trans-unit.source: By default, Server Manager starts when a member of the Administrators group logs on to a computer that is running Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: By default, Server Manager starts when a member of the Administrators group logs on to a computer that is running Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: If Server Manager is not already open, click **Start > Server Manager**.
trans-unit.target: If Server Manager is not already open, click **Start > Server Manager**.

trans-unit.source: ![Server Manager](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC740997.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Server Manager](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC740997.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Server Manager > Dashboard > Add roles and features**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Server Manager > Dashboard > Add roles and features**.

trans-unit.source: This starts the **Add Roles and Features** wizard.
trans-unit.target: This starts the **Add Roles and Features** wizard.

trans-unit.source: ![Add Roles And Features Wizard 1](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC740998.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Add Roles And Features Wizard 1](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC740998.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Roles and Features** wizard, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Roles and Features** wizard, do the following:

trans-unit.source: On the **Before you begin** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Before you begin** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select installation type** page, accept the default setting of **Role-based or feature-based** installation.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select installation type** page, accept the default setting of **Role-based or feature-based** installation.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 2](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC740999.png)
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 2](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC740999.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Select destination server** page, choose **Select a server from the server pool**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select destination server** page, choose **Select a server from the server pool**.

trans-unit.source: Your host server should be discovered automatically.
trans-unit.target: Your host server should be discovered automatically.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select server roles** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select server roles** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select features** page, select **Multipath I/O**, and click **Next**.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 5](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741000.png)
trans-unit.target: On the **Select features** page, select **Multipath I/O**, and click **Next**.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 5](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741000.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Confirm installation selections** page, confirm the selection and then select **Restart the destination server automatically if required**, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: On the **Confirm installation selections** page, confirm the selection and then select **Restart the destination server automatically if required**, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install**.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 8](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741001.png)
trans-unit.target: Click **Install**.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 8](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741001.png)

trans-unit.source: You will be notified when the installation is complete.
trans-unit.target: You will be notified when the installation is complete.

trans-unit.source: Click **Close** to close the wizard.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 9](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741002.png)
trans-unit.target: Click **Close** to close the wizard.![Add Roles And Features Wizard 9](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741002.png)

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Configure MPIO for StorSimple volumes
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Configure MPIO for StorSimple volumes

trans-unit.source: MPIO needs to be configured to identify StorSimple volumes.
trans-unit.target: MPIO needs to be configured to identify StorSimple volumes.

trans-unit.source: To configure MPIO to recognize StorSimple volumes, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To configure MPIO to recognize StorSimple volumes, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: To configure MPIO for StorSimple volumes
trans-unit.target: To configure MPIO for StorSimple volumes

trans-unit.source: Open the **MPIO configuration**.
trans-unit.target: Open the **MPIO configuration**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Server Manager > Dashboard > Tools > MPIO**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Server Manager > Dashboard > Tools > MPIO**.

trans-unit.source: In the **MPIO Properties** dialog box, select the **Discover Multi-Paths** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the **MPIO Properties** dialog box, select the **Discover Multi-Paths** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add support for iSCSI devices**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add support for iSCSI devices**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: ![MPIO Properties Discover Multi Paths](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741003.png)
trans-unit.target: ![MPIO Properties Discover Multi Paths](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741003.png)

trans-unit.source: Reboot the server when prompted.
trans-unit.target: Reboot the server when prompted.

trans-unit.source: In the **MPIO Properties** dialog box, click the **MPIO Devices** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the **MPIO Properties** dialog box, click the **MPIO Devices** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: ![MPIO Properties MPIO Devices](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741004.png)
trans-unit.target: ![MPIO Properties MPIO Devices](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741004.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **Add MPIO Support** dialog box, under **Device Hardware ID**, enter your device serial number.You can get the device serial number by accessing your StorSimple Manager service and navigating to **Devices > Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add MPIO Support** dialog box, under **Device Hardware ID**, enter your device serial number.You can get the device serial number by accessing your StorSimple Manager service and navigating to **Devices > Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: The device serial number is displayed in the right **Quick Glance** pane of the device dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The device serial number is displayed in the right **Quick Glance** pane of the device dashboard.

trans-unit.source: ![Add MPIO Support](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741005.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Add MPIO Support](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741005.png)

trans-unit.source: Reboot the server when prompted.
trans-unit.target: Reboot the server when prompted.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Mount StorSimple volumes on the host
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Mount StorSimple volumes on the host

trans-unit.source: After MPIO is configured on Windows Server, volume(s) created on the StorSimple device can be mounted and can then take advantage of MPIO for redundancy.
trans-unit.target: After MPIO is configured on Windows Server, volume(s) created on the StorSimple device can be mounted and can then take advantage of MPIO for redundancy.

trans-unit.source: To mount a volume, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To mount a volume, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: To mount volumes on the host
trans-unit.target: To mount volumes on the host

trans-unit.source: Open the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window on the Windows Server host.
trans-unit.target: Open the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window on the Windows Server host.

trans-unit.source: Click **Server Manager > Dashboard > Tools > iSCSI Initiator**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Server Manager > Dashboard > Tools > iSCSI Initiator**.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, click the Discovery tab, and then click **Discover Target Portal**.
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, click the Discovery tab, and then click **Discover Target Portal**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Discover Target Portal** dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the **Discover Target Portal** dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Enter the IP address of the DATA port of your StorSimple device (for example, enter DATA 0).
trans-unit.target: Enter the IP address of the DATA port of your StorSimple device (for example, enter DATA 0).

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a private network for iSCSI connections, enter the IP address of the DATA port that is connected to the private network.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a private network for iSCSI connections, enter the IP address of the DATA port that is connected to the private network.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 2-3 for a second network interface (for example, DATA 1) on your device.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 2-3 for a second network interface (for example, DATA 1) on your device.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that these interfaces should be enabled for iSCSI.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that these interfaces should be enabled for iSCSI.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about this, see [Modify network interfaces](storsimple-modify-device-config.md#modify-network-interfaces).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about this, see [Modify network interfaces](storsimple-modify-device-config.md#modify-network-interfaces).

trans-unit.source: Select the **Targets** tab in the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Targets** tab in the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: You should see the StorSimple device target IQN under **Discovered Targets**.
trans-unit.target: You should see the StorSimple device target IQN under **Discovered Targets**.

trans-unit.source: ![iSCSI Initiator Properties Targets Tab](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741007.png)
trans-unit.target: ![iSCSI Initiator Properties Targets Tab](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741007.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Connect** to establish an iSCSI session with your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connect** to establish an iSCSI session with your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: A **Connect to Target** dialog box will appear.
trans-unit.target: A **Connect to Target** dialog box will appear.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, select the **Enable multi-path** check box.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, select the **Enable multi-path** check box.

trans-unit.source: Click **Advanced**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Advanced**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: On the **Local Adapter** drop-down list, select **Microsoft iSCSI Initiator**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Local Adapter** drop-down list, select **Microsoft iSCSI Initiator**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address of the host.
trans-unit.target: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address of the host.

trans-unit.source: On the **Target Portal** IP drop-down list, select the IP of device interface.
trans-unit.target: On the **Target Portal** IP drop-down list, select the IP of device interface.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Click **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Properties** dialog box, click **Add Session**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Properties** dialog box, click **Add Session**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, select the **Enable multi-path** check box.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, select the **Enable multi-path** check box.

trans-unit.source: Click **Advanced**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Advanced**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: On the **Local adapter** drop-down list, select Microsoft iSCSI Initiator.
trans-unit.target: On the **Local adapter** drop-down list, select Microsoft iSCSI Initiator.

trans-unit.source: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address corresponding to the host.
trans-unit.target: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address corresponding to the host.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you are connecting two network interfaces on the device to a single network interface on the host.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you are connecting two network interfaces on the device to a single network interface on the host.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, this interface is the same as that provided for the first session.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, this interface is the same as that provided for the first session.

trans-unit.source: On the **Target Portal IP** drop-down list, select the IP address for the second data interface enabled on the device.
trans-unit.target: On the **Target Portal IP** drop-down list, select the IP address for the second data interface enabled on the device.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to return to the iSCSI Initiator Properties dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to return to the iSCSI Initiator Properties dialog box.

trans-unit.source: You have added a second session to the target.
trans-unit.target: You have added a second session to the target.

trans-unit.source: Open **Computer Management** by navigating to **Server Manager > Dashboard > Computer Management**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Computer Management** by navigating to **Server Manager > Dashboard > Computer Management**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, click **Storage > Disk Management**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, click **Storage > Disk Management**.

trans-unit.source: The volume(s) created on the StorSimple device that are visible to this host will appear under **Disk Management** as new disk(s).
trans-unit.target: The volume(s) created on the StorSimple device that are visible to this host will appear under **Disk Management** as new disk(s).

trans-unit.source: Initialize the disk and create a new volume.
trans-unit.target: Initialize the disk and create a new volume.

trans-unit.source: During the format process, select a block size of 64 KB.
trans-unit.target: During the format process, select a block size of 64 KB.

trans-unit.source: Disk Management
trans-unit.target: Disk Management

trans-unit.source: Under **Disk Management**, right-click the **Disk** and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Disk Management**, right-click the **Disk** and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the StorSimple Model #### **Multi-Path Disk Device Properties** dialog box, click the **MPIO tab**.
trans-unit.target: In the StorSimple Model #### **Multi-Path Disk Device Properties** dialog box, click the **MPIO tab**.

trans-unit.source: ![StorSimple 8100 Multi-Path Disk DeviceProp.](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741009.png)
trans-unit.target: ![StorSimple 8100 Multi-Path Disk DeviceProp.](./media/storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server/IC741009.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **DSM Name** section, click **Details** and verify that the parameters are set to the default parameters.The default parameters are:
trans-unit.target: In the **DSM Name** section, click **Details** and verify that the parameters are set to the default parameters.The default parameters are:

trans-unit.source: Path Verify Period = 30
trans-unit.target: Path Verify Period = 30

trans-unit.source: Retry Count = 3
trans-unit.target: Retry Count = 3

trans-unit.source: PDO Remove Period = 20
trans-unit.target: PDO Remove Period = 20

trans-unit.source: Retry Interval = 1
trans-unit.target: Retry Interval = 1

trans-unit.source: Path Verify Enabled = Unchecked.
trans-unit.target: Path Verify Enabled = Unchecked.

trans-unit.source: Please do not modify the default parameters.
trans-unit.target: Please do not modify the default parameters.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Configure MPIO for high availability and load balancing
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Configure MPIO for high availability and load balancing

trans-unit.source: For multi-path based high availability and load balancing, multiple sessions must be manually added to declare the different paths available.
trans-unit.target: For multi-path based high availability and load balancing, multiple sessions must be manually added to declare the different paths available.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the host has two interfaces connected to SAN and the device has two interfaces connected to SAN, then you need four sessions configured with proper path permutations (only two sessions will be required if each DATA interface and host interface is on a different IP subnet and is not routable).
trans-unit.target: For example, if the host has two interfaces connected to SAN and the device has two interfaces connected to SAN, then you need four sessions configured with proper path permutations (only two sessions will be required if each DATA interface and host interface is on a different IP subnet and is not routable).

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you do not mix 1 GbE and 10 GbE network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you do not mix 1 GbE and 10 GbE network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: If you use two network interfaces, both interfaces should be the identical type.
trans-unit.target: If you use two network interfaces, both interfaces should be the identical type.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure describes how to add sessions when a StorSimple device with two network interfaces is connected to a host with two network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure describes how to add sessions when a StorSimple device with two network interfaces is connected to a host with two network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: To configure MPIO for high availability and load balancing
trans-unit.target: To configure MPIO for high availability and load balancing

trans-unit.source: Perform a discovery of the target: in the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, on the **Discovery** tab, click **Discover Portal**.
trans-unit.target: Perform a discovery of the target: in the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, on the **Discovery** tab, click **Discover Portal**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, enter the IP address of one of the device network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, enter the IP address of one of the device network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, select the **Targets** tab, highlight the discovered target, and then click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, select the **Targets** tab, highlight the discovered target, and then click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: The **Connect to Target** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Connect to Target** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Leave the default selected target setting for **Add this connection** to the list of favorite targets.
trans-unit.target: Leave the default selected target setting for **Add this connection** to the list of favorite targets.

trans-unit.source: This will make the device automatically attempt to restart the connection every time this computer restarts.
trans-unit.target: This will make the device automatically attempt to restart the connection every time this computer restarts.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enable multi-path** check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enable multi-path** check box.

trans-unit.source: Click **Advanced**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Advanced**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: On the **Local Adapter** drop-down list, select **Microsoft iSCSI Initiator**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Local Adapter** drop-down list, select **Microsoft iSCSI Initiator**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address of the host.
trans-unit.target: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address of the host.

trans-unit.source: On the **Target Portal IP** drop-down list, select the IP address of the data interface enabled on the device.
trans-unit.target: On the **Target Portal IP** drop-down list, select the IP address of the data interface enabled on the device.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to return to the iSCSI Initiator Properties dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to return to the iSCSI Initiator Properties dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Click **Properties**, and in the **Properties** dialog box, click **Add Session**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Properties**, and in the **Properties** dialog box, click **Add Session**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, select the **Enable multi-path** check box, and then click **Advanced**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Target** dialog box, select the **Enable multi-path** check box, and then click **Advanced**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Settings** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: On the **Local adapter** drop-down list, select **Microsoft iSCSI Initiator**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Local adapter** drop-down list, select **Microsoft iSCSI Initiator**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address corresponding to the second interface on the host.
trans-unit.target: On the **Initiator IP** drop-down list, select the IP address corresponding to the second interface on the host.

trans-unit.source: On the **Target Portal IP** drop-down list, select the IP address for the second data interface enabled on the device.
trans-unit.target: On the **Target Portal IP** drop-down list, select the IP address for the second data interface enabled on the device.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to return to the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: You have now added a second session to the target.
trans-unit.target: You have now added a second session to the target.

trans-unit.source: Repeat Steps 8-10 to add additional sessions (paths) to the target.
trans-unit.target: Repeat Steps 8-10 to add additional sessions (paths) to the target.

trans-unit.source: With two interfaces on the host and two on the device, you can add a total of four sessions.
trans-unit.target: With two interfaces on the host and two on the device, you can add a total of four sessions.

trans-unit.source: After adding the desired sessions (paths), in the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, select the target and click **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: After adding the desired sessions (paths), in the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** dialog box, select the target and click **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: On the Sessions tab of the **Properties** dialog box, note the four session identifiers that correspond to the possible path permutations.
trans-unit.target: On the Sessions tab of the **Properties** dialog box, note the four session identifiers that correspond to the possible path permutations.

trans-unit.source: To cancel a session, select the check box next to a session identifier, and then click **Disconnect**.
trans-unit.target: To cancel a session, select the check box next to a session identifier, and then click **Disconnect**.

trans-unit.source: To view devices presented within sessions, select the **Devices** tab.
trans-unit.target: To view devices presented within sessions, select the **Devices** tab.

trans-unit.source: To configure the MPIO policy for a selected device, click **MPIO**.
trans-unit.target: To configure the MPIO policy for a selected device, click **MPIO**.

trans-unit.source: The **Device Details** dialog box will appear.
trans-unit.target: The **Device Details** dialog box will appear.

trans-unit.source: On the **MPIO** tab, you can select the appropriate **Load Balance Policy** settings.
trans-unit.target: On the **MPIO** tab, you can select the appropriate **Load Balance Policy** settings.

trans-unit.source: You can also view the **Active** or **Standby** path type.
trans-unit.target: You can also view the **Active** or **Standby** path type.
